message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about sound and how it behaves in an enclosed space. When a sound is produced inside a room, there can be a delayed reflection, also known as an echo. This is when the sound waves bounce off the walls, floor, and ceiling of the room, causing a second, fainter sound to be heard after the initial sound. Option (A) is incorrect because light is not related to the production of sound. Option (B) is also incorrect because an electric charge is not a typical result of producing a sound. Option (D) is unrelated to sound production and refers to a video, which is a visual medium.

Option (B) is also incorrect because sound and electric charge are unrelated. Option (D) is not related to the question at all and is a distractor.
